Posts.Content: srhughes wrote: My issue started about a month ago and I got really sore on the outside of my left breast and found a lump at about 7:00 on the inside of my left breast and also have been having a green discharge.  I have had a non-cancerous lump removed about 3 years ago in the same breast.  Went for a mammogram and an ultrasound and it showed fibrodense tissue.  Surgeon stated that if the ultrasound showed up nothing not to worry and was diagnosed with nonlactating mastitis.  I am on my third round of antibiotics.  I have taken Doxycycline, Kaflex, and finishing up my Levoquin  with no results. I am having a serious amount of swelling and pain.  My gynecologist is sending me to a different surgeon tomorrow for possible milk duct removal.  Should i be getting prepared for breast cancer or is this maybe just a bad milk duct?  Please advise - any input would be greatly appreciated!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast problems srhughes Moderators
